onCreateViewHolder(android.view.ViewGrou.Description: Constructs a @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedActionsStylist#ViewHolder_E@ capable of representing @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction_E@s. Subclasses may choose to return a subclass of ViewHolder. To support different view types, override @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedActionsStylist#onCreateViewHolder_E@

Returns: True if it is button actions list, false for normal actions list.
isButtonActions().Description: Returns true if it is button actions list, false for normal actions list.

Parameters: boolean: True to enable using BACK key to collapse sub actions list, false to disable.
setBackKeyToCollapseSubActions(boolean).Description: Enable or disable using BACK key to collapse sub actions list. Default is enabled.

Returns: The resource ID of the layout to be inflated to define the view to display an individual GuidedAction.
onProvideItemLayoutId(int).Description: Provides the resource ID of the layout defining the view for an individual guided actions. Subclasses may override to provide their own customized layouts. The base implementation supports: @B_android#support#v17#leanback#R#layout#lb_guidedactions_item_E@ {@B_android#support#v17#leanback#R#layout#lb_guidedactions_datepicker_item_E@. If overridden, the substituted layout should contain matching IDs for any views that should be managed by the base class; this can be achieved by starting with a copy of the base layout file. Note that in order for the item to support editing, the title view should both subclass @B_android#widget#EditText_E@ and implement @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ImeKeyMonitor_E@; see @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedActionEditText_E@.

Returns: True if it is running an expanding or collapsing transition, false otherwise.
isInExpandTransition().Description: Returns true if it is running an expanding or collapsing transition, false otherwise.

The resource ID of the layout to be inflated to define the view to display an individual GuidedAction.
onProvideItemLayoutId().Description: Provides the resource ID of the layout defining the view for an individual guided actions. Subclasses may override to provide their own customized layouts. The base implementation returns @B_android#support#v17#leanback#R#layout#lb_guidedactions_item_E@. If overridden, the substituted layout should contain matching IDs for any views that should be managed by the base class; this can be achieved by starting with a copy of the base layout file. Note that in order for the item to support editing, the title view should both subclass @B_android#widget#EditText_E@ and implement @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ImeKeyMonitor_E@; see @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedActionEditText_E@. To support different types of Layouts, override @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedActionsStylist#onProvideItemLayoutId_E@.

Returns: The resource ID of the layout to be inflated to define the host view for the list of GuidedActions.
onProvideLayoutId().Description: Provides the resource ID of the layout defining the host view for the list of guided actions. Subclasses may override to provide their own customized layouts. The base implementation returns @B_android#support#v17#leanback#R#layout#lb_guidedactions_E@ or @B_android#support#v17#leanback#R#layout#lb_guidedbuttonactions_E@ if @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedActionsStylist#isButtonActions_E@ is true. If overridden, the substituted layout should contain matching IDs for any views that should be managed by the base class; this can be achieved by starting with a copy of the base layout file.

Returns: True if it is running an expanding or collapsing transition, false otherwise.
isExpandTransitionSupported().Description: Returns if expand/collapse animation is supported. When this method returns true, @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedActionsStylist#startExpandedTransition_E@ will be used. When this method returns false, @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedActionsStylist#onUpdateExpandedViewHolder_E@ will be called.

Returns: True if using BACK key to collapse sub actions list, false otherwise. Default value is true.

setAsButtonActions().Description: Choose the layout resource for button actions in @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedActionsStylist#onProvideLayoutId_E@.

ClassDesc: GuidedActionsStylist is used within a @B_android#support#v17#leanback#app#GuidedStepFragment_E@ to supply the right-side panel where users can take actions. It consists of a container for the list of actions, and a stationary selector view that indicates visually the location of focus. GuidedActionsStylist has two different layouts: default is for normal actions including text, radio, checkbox, DatePicker, etc, the other when @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedActionsStylist#setAsButtonActions_E@ is called is recommended for button actions such as "yes", "no". Many aspects of the base GuidedActionsStylist can be customized through theming; see the theme attributes below. Note that these attributes are not set on individual elements in layout XML, but instead would be set in a custom theme. See If these hooks are insufficient, this class may also be subclassed. Subclasses may wish to override the @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedActionsStylist#onProvideLayoutId_E@ method to change the layout used to display the list container and selector; override @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedActionsStylist#onProvideItemLayoutId_E@ and @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedActionsStylist#getItemViewType_E@ method to change the layout used to display each action. To support a "click to activate" view similar to DatePicker, app needs: Override @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedActionsStylist#onProvideItemLayoutId_E@ and @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedActionsStylist#getItemViewType_E@, provides a layout id for the action. The layout must include a widget with id "guidedactions_activator_item", the widget is toggled edit mode by https:##developer#android#com@B_android#view#View#setActivated_E@. Override @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedActionsStylist#onBindActivatorView_E@ to populate values into View. Override @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedActionsStylist#onUpdateActivatorView_E@ to update action. Note: If an alternate list layout is provided, the following view IDs must be supplied: @B_android#support#v17#leanback#R#id#guidedactions_list_E@ These view IDs must be present in order for the stylist to function. The list ID must correspond to a @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#VerticalGridView_E@ or subclass. If an alternate item layout is provided, the following view IDs should be used to refer to base elements: @B_android#support#v17#leanback#R#id#guidedactions_item_content_E@ @B_android#support#v17#leanback#R#id#guidedactions_item_title_E@ @B_android#support#v17#leanback#R#id#guidedactions_item_description_E@ @B_android#support#v17#leanback#R#id#guidedactions_item_icon_E@ @B_android#support#v17#leanback#R#id#guidedactions_item_checkmark_E@ @B_android#support#v17#leanback#R#id#guidedactions_item_chevron_E@ These view IDs are allowed to be missing, in which case the corresponding views in @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedActionsStylist#ViewHolder_E@ will be null. In order to support editable actions, the view associated with guidedactions_item_title should be a subclass of https:##developer#android#com@B_android#widget#EditText_E@, and should satisfy the @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ImeKeyMonitor_E@ interface.
